description:
Torrenting, or P2P (peer-to-peer) file sharing, is a convenient way to download large files quickly. But it isn’t without its risks. Not only is there the risk of accidentally downloading a malicious file or malware, but there’s a privacy risk as well — your ISP can see all your online activity and they usually don’t take too kindly to torrenting.

That’s why it’s imperative that you use a VPN while doing any torrenting or P2P file sharing. A VPN can keep your connection private and encrypt your data so that unwanted prying eyes — cybercriminals, overbearing ISPs, or nosy government watchdogs — can’t monitor your online ac
title: Best VPNs for torrenting: 5 top picks for speed, privacy, and security

description:
Google said Tuesday that it’s testing a new experimental search app for Windows that will search your PC as well as the web, applying Google Lens when needed.

Google classified its new app as an “experiment,” relegating it to its Labs program for now. The app is simply called “Google app for Windows,” and was explained in a terse blog post on Google’s site.

“Now you can search without switching windows or interrupting your flow,” Google said. “Whether you’re writing in a doc or in the middle of a game, just press Alt + Space to instantly search for information from your computer files, installed apps, Google Drive files — and of course, the web.”

Interestingly, Google did not brand the search ap
title: Google’s new AI app searches ‘anything,’ including your PC

description:
If you end up searching for Chrome in Bing Search with Microsoft Edge, you might start seeing a new advertisement that says “All you need is right here,” reports Windows Latest.

The advertisement includes a table that compares features between Chrome and Edge and tries to sell you on the browser by saying “Microsoft Edge runs on the same technology as Chrome, with the added trust of Microsoft.” You’ll also spot quick links to apps like YouTube, Facebook, Gmail, WhatsApp, Instagram, and Netflix.

It’s no secret that Microsoft really, really wants users to stick with Edge and will do anything it can to deter users from switching to Chrome. In the past, Microsoft injected an
title: Microsoft tries new trick to dissuade Edge users downloading Chrome

description:
The SK Hynix Tube T31 is hands down one of the best portable SSDs we’ve tested. It’s blazing fast and has a sleek design that could easily be mistaken for a USB flash drive—what more could you want? Right now, you can snag the 1TB model for just $60 (was $84), which matches the lowest price we’ve ever seen for it.

When we reviewed the SK Hynix Tube T31, we gave it a glowing 4.5-star rating for its design and performance. It’s super compact, making it an excellent pocket-friendly option for portable SSDs. But what really wowed us was its speed, reaching up to 1,000 MB/s in our tests. That means lightning-fast file transfers!

Keep in mind that a 1TB USB flash drive would normally cost you around $80 to $10
title: We love this 1TB SSD that looks like a flash drive — and it’s only $60 now

description:
4K resolution is now within reach of everyday PC users, promising a massive improvement to image quality, with four times the pixels of a 1080p display. A 4K monitor is useful not only in games and movies but also when editing documents or browsing web pages. The extra pixels make text look clear and crisp.

After extensive testing, I’ve determined that the recommendations listed below are the best 4K monitors available today, covering a variety of budgets and use cases.
title: Best 4K monitors: HDR, gaming, budget, and best overall

description:
Be honest: how many good USB cables do you have? You know, ones that didn’t come with your phone or earbuds from years ago, and ones that haven’t been bent out of shape or torn apart by your cat. If you want to truly fast charge your devices, you might want to step up your cables—and right now, you can get this 2-pack of 100W Anker USB-C cables for $9 on Amazon with a crazy 44% discount.

These are 100W USB-C cables, meaning they’ll fast charge your devices as long as you have a charging block, wall plug, or power bank that’s capable of pushing that much power. It’s perfect for your smartphone, tablet, earbuds, and even some laptop models.

These cables are braided nylon, which means they’ll resist lots of twists and bends, getting shoved into a bag pocket, and so on. Th
title: Grab a pair of fast-charging Anker USB-C cables for just $9 on sale

description:
Keyboards have gotten kind of crazy lately, as the mechanical trend extends to every facet of the niche and companies search for some kind of edge. Keychron, one of the most visible specialists, is not immune from the hunt for the next big thing—which appears to be ceramics. Indeed, the new Q16 HE keyboard is all ceramic, all the time.

If you haven’t been exhaustively looking at the trends in the keyboard niche, ceramic material for keycaps is kind of a big deal. It’s exactly what it sounds like: heavy, clay-based material covered in a layer of smooth polish, which offers a smooth feel that’s unlike even the most premium plastic. It’s also loud, with a distinct “clack” that comes with every keypress. (Maybe don
title: Keychron introduces world-first all-ceramic mechanical keyboard

description:
We love massive monitors and OLED panels as much as the next enthusiast, but there’s no denying that massive OLED displays are pretty darn expensive. That’s why if you’re in the market for one and you spot a big sale, you should jump on it—like this 49-inch Innocn ultrawide 1440p monitor that’s now $795 (was $1,000) on Amazon.

This ultrawide monitor is absolutely massive at 49 inches, with a gorgeous 5120×1440 resolution (that’s basically two regular 1440p monitors side by side without an annoying bezel down the middle) and a lovely OLED panel for vibrant colors, deep blacks, and glorious visuals.

It’s adequate for modest gaming with its 144Hz refresh rate and 0.03ms response time, so you can easily switch from spreadsheets and documents to 3D gaming in a snap. Plus, the gentle 1800R cu
title: Get this 49-inch ultrawide OLED monitor for over $200 off right now

description:
A few weeks ago, when I was getting ready to go live on This Week in Tech’s Windows Weekly video podcast, TWiT’s studio engineer said my microphone and webcam setup looked great. I mentioned I was using a ring light, too. “I can tell,” he said.

A good image is about more than just your webcam. Lighting is critical and can make the difference between an ad hoc amateur look and a professional one. Natural lighting can be tough to wrangle though, especially because it shifts over the course of the day, with cloud cover, weather, etc. And even in a well-lit room, all your lamps still might not provide the amount of light you need for your face.

A ring light is the ultimate solution because it’s so inexpensive, so easy to use, and so versatile no matter your setup. You don’t need AI lighting effects, you don’t have to rethink
title: I bought a $15 ring light to use with my webcam. I wish I’d done it sooner

description:
Last week, Microsoft released an important Windows 11 patch known as update KB5065426. Unfortunately, it didn’t take long for error reports to start pouring in from users who have been running into all kinds of error codes during installation of the update.

With it being a mandatory update, the Windows Update system will periodically keep trying to install the update even if users have declined, reports Windows Latest. That’
title: Windows 11’s September update is borked, won’t install for some users

title: Private Internet Access review: A low-price, high-value VPN

description:
Why spend a ton of money on a laptop when you could spend less on a mini PC that offers as good performance? Not only that, a mini PC takes up less space on your desk! It’s honestly the best choice for most people—and that choice just became easier now that this Kamrui AM21 mini PC is on sale for $499.99 (was $669.99) on Amazon. That’s a whopping $170 off on a powerful machine that’ll serve you well for years.

Let’s talk specs. This tiny little PC runs on an AMD Ryzen 7 8745HS processor with Zen 4 architecture and 8 cores, able to boost up to 4.9GHz for real day-to-day power. It’s bolstered by a chunky 32GB of fast DDR5 RAM and a fast 1TB PCIe 4.0 SSD for responsive performance and plenty of storage space. It’s also user-upgradeable, so you can further expand it to 96GB of RAM and 4TB of storage
title: This Ryzen 7 mini PC with 32GB RAM is a banger — and now 25% off

description:
Most people will put a lot of thought into their CPU and GPU requirements when buying or building a new PC, but the storage often gets left by the wayside or is considered only insofar as picking an SSD as opposed to an HDD.

But truth be told, not all SSDs are equal. Without proper consideration of things like the type, size, form, and speed of your SSD, you could be jeopardizing your PC performance. Here are the key points you ought to consider to maximize buying an SSD.

1. W
title: Buying an SSD? Ask yourself these 4 crucial questions first

description:
Talk to the palm! That’s the idea behind a growing number of smart locks that can read your palm rather than your fingerprint, and budget smart home manufacturer Wyze has just announced its own take. 

Available starting today, the Wyze Palm Lock isn’t the first smart lock capable of the palm-reading trick; recent locks from Eufy, TP-Link’s Tapo brand, TCL, and Phillips can do the same thing. 

What sets the Wyze Palm Lock apart is (unsurprisingly for Wyze, a company known for its budget-friendly devices) the price: just $129.99, versus $200 for the TCL D1 Pro Palm Vein Smart Lock and a whopping $399 for the
title: Wyze tries its hand at a palm-reading smart lock

description:
This year’s second Prime Day event is landing in just a few weeks! Prime Big Deal Days is kicking off on October 7th and will last through the end of October 8th. Unlike July’s successful four-day sales event, this one goes back to its roots and will only last two days.

Over the last few years, we’ve seen two big Prime Day events every year with special deals and discounts for Prime members, with the first one taking place in July and the second in October. Keep reading to learn more about the Prime Big Deal Days event coming up.

When is Prime Big Deal Days in 2025?
title: Amazon’s ‘Prime Big Deal Days’ returns October 7-8: All you need to know

description:
Microsoft is making a free version of the Copilot Chat capability available to every Microsoft 365 user, although more premium capabilities will still be locked behind a subscription.

The Chat window will now appear inside Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and OneNote, allowing users to query a document, create images, and more. Microsoft says you’ll now be able to do even more, with multiple image uploads permitted within the app. The input box has been widened as well, presumably to present Copilot as a collaborative tool that shares priority with the document itself.

Microsoft is also making GPT-5 part of the Copilot experience, as it has said before.

Licensed Copilot users now get access to Researcher and Analyst
title: Microsoft adds free Copilot Chat to Microsoft 365 apps

description:

title: Word, Excel, PowerPoint & More — Lifetime License for $30
